did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Personal and official correspondence, financial records, notes, a photograph album, and photographs relating chiefly to personal and family life.

prefercite.head: Credit Line
prefercite.p: Behan Family papers (AZ 011). Special Collections, University of Arizona Libraries.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Pioneer Arizona family, prominent in public service and law enforcement. John Behan, 1845-1912, was county deputy sheriff at Tombstone, Ariz., 1879-1881, then became first county sheriff when Cochise County was created in 1881. He served as sheriff of several other Arizona counties during his career. He also served as Chinese Inspector, 1896-1897; worked in government service, in Cuba during the War of 1898, and in China during the Boxer Rebellion; and as business manager of the Tucson Citizen, 1901-1911. Julia Behan was his sister. Albert P. Behan, his son, worked for the U.S. Customs Service along the Mexican border, 1913-1928.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: This collection is organized into two series:

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Personal and official correspondence, financial records, notes, a photograph album, and photographs relating chiefly to personal and family life. Includes approximately 100 photographs of family members; most are studio portraits. A photograph album contains snapshots of Julia Behan, her family and friends, in California, 1907-1924. Also present is a diary of John Behan's railway travels, expenses, and inspections while a Chinese Inspector, 1896-1897; and account books and journals from Albert Behan's customs work.

controlaccess.subject: Smuggling -- United States -- History -- Sources

controlaccess.geogname: United States -- Emigration and immigration -- History -- Sources

did.unittitle: John H. Behan: letters and miscellaneous material. 1883-1910

scopecontent.p: Contains several account record books, railroad passes and membership cards; a legal document appointing John. H. Behan as Railway Policeman for the Southern Pacific Company; miscellaneous personal and business correspondence. Also contains a section of letters from "Bert."
Contains one leather bound diary with notes about Behan's railway travels, expenses and inspections. The diary is inscribed, "John H. Behan, Chinese Inspector."

did.unittitle: Albert P. Behan: letters and miscellaneous material. 1908-1940

scopecontent.p: Contains mainly miscellaneous personal correspondence received by Albert P. Behan.

did.unittitle: Albert P. Behan: Customs collector on Mexican border. 1913-1928

scopecontent.p: Contains several small account books and journals from Albert P. Behan's work with the U.S. Customs Service along the Mexican border, plus a Treasury Department manual for the Guidance of the Outdoor Force of the Customs Service. Also contains several letters on Treasury Department letterhead.

did.unittitle: Albert P. Behan: miscellaneous financial records. 1914-1944

scopecontent.p: Contains several small ban account record books and other bank records, plus miscellaneous papers relating to personal property.

did.unittitle: Julia M. Behan: will, estate papers. 1931-1936

scopecontent.p: Contains will, and estate papers of Julia M. Behan, and a letter from the California Trust company to Albert T. Behan regarding same, dated 1936. Also contains a handwritten bill of sale from a gallery in Florence, Italy.

did.unittitle: Behan Family: photo album, and letter from Mrs. Nancy Behan Meeker. 1907-1924
Photographs: miscellaneous photographs, mainly portraits of Behan family members.
